title.native: ジョジョの奇妙な冒険 ダイヤモンドは砕けない
title.romaji: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Diamond wa Kudakenai
title.english: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond is Unbreakable

description:
JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken: Diamond wa Kudakenai adapts the fourth part of the JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken manga series.

It's the year 1999, 11 years after Jotaro Kujo's desperate fight against DIO in Egypt. Jotaro meets with Josuke Higashikata, the illegitimate son of his grandfather Joseph Joestar. He discovers that Josuke also has the same "Stand" power and that a new threat is surfacing in Morioh City.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 4: Diamond wa Kudakenai
JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Part 4: Diamond is Unbreakable
مغامرات جوجو العجيبة: الألماس غير قابل للكسر
Le bizzarre avventure di JoJo: Diamond is Unbreakable

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Feet
tags.description: Features the sexual depiction or stimulation of a character's feet.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

トニオ・トラサルディー

node.description:
Hirohiko Araki is a manga artist. He left school before graduation from Miyagi University of Education.  

Araki is best known for his long-running series JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, published in Weekly Shonen Jump starting in 1987. The story is full of references to Western music and Italy, both of which Araki is reportedly very fond. Many of Araki's creations have been translated and released in Europe but so far only JoJo's Bizarre Adventure and Baoh have been released in the United States. One popular theory is that Araki's frequent references to Western music may violate American copyright laws. Viz has eluded much of this problem in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by replacing some band references with album or song references, which do not appear to be as strictly guarded. Araki is a recipient of the Tezuka Award.   

(Source: JoJo's Bizarre Encyclopedia)
She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).

[1st Twitter](https://twitter.com/NishiiTerumi) | [2nd Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nishiiterumi1) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/teruminishii.bsky.social) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCRVXG5v77o6zvzBxb9NxffQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/terumi_nishii/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=17680136) | [Website](http://studio-meiris.com/)

Initially wanting to become a mangaka, it wasn't until while studying at Osaka Designers' College that Ishii thought about becoming an animator after having seen [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/), a show directed by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/). Shortly thereafter a re-telling movie for the series was announced and Nishii set her sights on being part of the production. After graduating she joined Studio Cockpit and managed to make her debut on the film as an in-betweener.

In 2011, she made her debut as a character designer on [Penguindrum](https://anilist.co/anime/10721/), another show of Ikuhara's.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉原俊一郎)

Affiliated with studio Bihou.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岩浪美和) | [Twitter](https://x.com/i/user/169097071)
[Website](http://www.yugokanno.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yugokanno)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/savagegarden)

Savage Garden were an Australian pop duo consisting of Darren Hayes as vocalist and Daniel Jones as instrumentalist.
[Twitter](https://x.com/nicorank) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/knisizima)
A regular presence in [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/)'s shows.

batta is a Japanese 4-person Rock band who performed "chase", the second opening for JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond is Unbreakable and the sixth opening overall for the JoJo's Bizarre Adventure series.

Its members consist of Tatsu Hoshino (ホシノ タツ) as the vocalist and guitarist, Tomomori Mano (マノ トモノリ) as the guitarist, Takashi Ishiwata as the support bassist as of May 2017, and Takeshi Hoshino (ホシノ タケシ) as the drummer.

Asato Shinohara (シノハラ アサト) was the original support bassist when the band performed for JoJo, but left the band in April 2017. Kazuhiro Tanizaki (タニザキ カズヒロ) and Masaki Yoshida (ヨシダ マサキ) were former drummers in the band but left before the group performed chase.

(Source: JoJo's Bizarre Encyclopedia).

Karen Aoki (青木 カレン) is a Japanese jazz vocalist and singer-songwriter. She performed "Great Days" along with Daisuke Hasegawa, the third opening for JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond is Unbreakable and the seventh opening overall for JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The Animation.

(Source: JoJo's Bizarre Encyclopedia)

__Members:__
- Jun Shirota (城田純)
- Jeity (ジェイティ)
- Taisuke Wada (和田泰右)

THE DU is a Japanese band created for performing "Crazy Noisy Bizarre Town," the 1st opening for JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond is Unbreakable and the 5th opening overall for JoJo's Bizarre Adventure.

(Source: JoJo's Bizarre Encyclopedia).
[Website](https://daisukehasegawa.net/)

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zzy_yamaguchi)
A regular presence in [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/)'s shows.
**Yukihiko Asaki (朝木幸彦)** is a Japanese production manager and episode director.
Facebook Yuuta Takamura is a Japanese freelance director, episode director and storyboard artist.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hairaito78)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/古川順康)

Started off as an editor at [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/古川順康)

Started off as an editor at [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/).
A regular presence in [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/)'s shows.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YasufumiSoejima/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/soejima_yasufumi/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ys19710313)

A director with past experience in computer graphics. Former CG animator and director at [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/GONZO). He is currently affiliated with [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/).
